metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11358 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
jQuery before 3.4.0, as used in Drupal, Backdrop CMS, and other products, mishandles jQuery.extend(true, {}, ...) because of Object.prototype pollution. If an unsanitized source object contained an enumerable __proto__ property, it could extend the native Object.prototype.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11358` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-jquery - 3.3.1~dfsg-3
No subscription required

node-jquery - 2.2.4+dfsg-4
No subscription required

otrs - 6.0.26-1
otrs2 - 6.0.26-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jquery package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.1~dfsg-3').
mediawiki package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
node-jquery package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.4+dfsg-4').
otrs2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.26-1').
